content.rendered:
Pr. Irvine Gwatiringa, Director

gwatiringai@sid.adventist.org

MOTIVATION

 

The history of the Seventh-day Adventist church is replete with evidence of youth being in the forefront of the mission activities of the Advent Movement. Our pioneers were young when they zealously proclaimed the second coming of Jesus Christ.

The history of the youth department also attests to two youths in their teens-Luther Warren and Harry Fenner; after seeking for God’s guidance, initiated a vibrant youth movement in 1879. SID youth under the age of 30 are challenged to be actively involved in the mission of the church. We promote Total Youth Involvement (TYI) as “We Go” to advance the “Advent Message to all the world in our generation.”

VISION

 

Seventh-day Adventist children and youth fulfilling the Gospel Commission in the SID territory in accordance with Matthew 28:19-20, Revelation 14:6-12 and the Aim of the youth ministries department.

MISSION

 

To lead Young People into a saving relationship with Jesus Christ and help them embrace His call to Discipleship.

AY Organogram

Ministries

Junior Youth Ministries

6 Classes and NEW GC ADVENTURER CURRICULUM

Adventurer Curriculum

6 Classes and NEW GC PATHFINDER CURRICULUM

Pathfinder Curriculum

Senior Youth Ministries

Ambassadors Curriculum

Young Adults Curriculum

AYM Leaderchip Courses

The Master Guide Curriculum is a leadership course for the Junior Youth Ministries (Adventurers and Pathfinders) and the Senior Youth Leader is the leadership course for the Senior Youth Ministries (Ambassadors and Young Adults).

Master Guide Curriculum

SYL Curriculum

World Pathfinder Day 2021

Official Promotional video
